direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods validate IP addresses but for different IP versions (IPv4 vs. IPv6).
The isValid method internally calls isValidInet4Address and isValidInet6Address, making it a direct dependency.
Both methods use regular expressions to validate input strings, sharing similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods validate input strings, but validate performs additional processing and returns a different type of result.
Both methods validate input strings, but isValid in RegexValidator is more general and can be used for different types of validations.
